rules.name: Insufficient Flow Control Mechanisms
rules.description: Checks for proper branch protection, approval processes, and access controls to prevent unauthorized code changes
rules.remediation: Implement proper branch protection rules, require code reviews, and enforce separation of duties

rules.name: Inadequate Identity and Access Management
rules.description: Detects excessive permissions, overly broad access, and lack of least privilege principle
rules.owasp_cicd_top10_category: CI/CD-SEC-2: Inadequate Identity and Access Management
rules.remediation: Implement least privilege principle, use temporary credentials, and set proper IAM controls

rules.name: Dependency Chain Abuse
rules.description: Identifies unverified dependencies, lack of lockfiles, and vulnerable package usage
rules.remediation: Use dependency lockfiles, verify package integrity with checksums, and scan dependencies for vulnerabilities

rules.name: Poisoned Pipeline Execution
rules.description: Checks for command injection vulnerabilities in pipeline scripts and unsanitized inputs
rules.remediation: Sanitize inputs, avoid using eval() or similar functions, and validate all user-supplied data

rules.name: Insufficient PBAC (Pipeline-Based Access Controls)
rules.description: Detects lack of proper access controls within pipeline stages and job separation
rules.remediation: Implement proper access controls between pipeline stages and separate sensitive operations

rules.name: Insufficient Credential Hygiene
rules.description: Identifies hardcoded credentials, improperly stored secrets, and insecure credential handling
rules.remediation: Use secret management services, avoid hardcoded credentials, and rotate secrets regularly

rules.name: Insecure System Configuration
rules.description: Detects insecure defaults, lack of hardening, and misconfigured CI/CD systems
rules.remediation: Follow security hardening guidelines, disable unnecessary services, and use secure defaults

rules.name: Ungoverned Usage of 3rd Party Services
rules.description: Checks for unverified third-party actions, services, and integrations
rules.owasp_cicd_top10_category: CI/CD-SEC-8: Ungoverned Usage of 3rd Party Services
rules.remediation: Verify third-party services, pin versions, and limit permissions granted to external services

rules.name: Improper Artifact Integrity Validation
rules.description: Identifies lack of signing, verification, and integrity checks for artifacts and images
rules.remediation: Implement artifact signing, verify signatures before deployment, and generate SBOMs

rules.name: Insufficient Logging and Visibility
rules.description: Detects inadequate logging, monitoring, and audit trails in CI/CD pipelines
rules.remediation: Implement comprehensive logging, set up alerts for suspicious activities, and maintain audit trails
